mn22:13.1.pli: Kullūpamaṁ vo, bhikkhave, dhammaṁ desessāmi nittharaṇatthāya, no gahaṇatthāya.
mn22:13.1.en: Mendicants, I will teach you how the Dhamma is similar to a raft: it’s for crossing over, not for holding on.

mn22:13.11.pli: Yannūnāhaṁ tiṇakaṭṭhasākhāpalāsaṁ saṅkaḍḍhitvā, kullaṁ bandhitvā, taṁ kullaṁ nissāya hatthehi ca pādehi ca vāyamamāno sotthinā pāraṁ uttareyyan’ti.
mn22:13.11.en: ‘Why don’t I gather grass, sticks, branches, and leaves and make a raft? Riding on the raft, and paddling with my hands and feet, I can safely reach the far shore.’

mn22:13.15.pli: imāhaṁ kullaṁ nissāya hatthehi ca pādehi ca vāyamamāno sotthinā pāraṁ uttiṇṇo.
mn22:13.15.en: Riding on the raft, and paddling with my hands and feet, I have safely crossed over to the far shore.

mn22:13.20.pli: “Kathaṅkārī ca so, bhikkhave, puriso tasmiṁ kulle kiccakārī assa?
mn22:13.20.en: “And what, mendicants, should that person do with the raft?

mn22:13.26.pli: Evameva kho, bhikkhave, kullūpamo mayā dhammo desito nittharaṇatthāya, no gahaṇatthāya.
mn22:13.26.en: In the same way, I have taught how the teaching is similar to a raft: it’s for crossing over, not for holding on.

mn22:14.1.pli: Kullūpamaṁ vo, bhikkhave, dhammaṁ desitaṁ, ājānantehi dhammāpi vo pahātabbā pageva adhammā.
mn22:14.1.en: By understanding the simile of the raft, you will even give up the teachings, let alone what is against the teachings.

Middle Discourses 22
The Simile of the Snake

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.10.2.pli: Aññataro bhikkhu heṭṭhā hutvā gopānasiṁ uccāresi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.10.2.en: A monk who was below lifted up a rafter.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.10.8.pli: Aññataro bhikkhu heṭṭhā hutvā gopānasiṁ uccāresi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.10.8.en: A monk who was below lifted up a rafter.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.10.9.pli: Uparimo bhikkhu maraṇādhippāyo heṭṭhimassa bhikkhuno matthake gopānasiṁ muñci.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.10.9.en: A second monk who was above, meaning to cause the death of the monk below, dropped the rafter on his head.

mlDocs.title:
Heartfelt Sayings
The Layfolk of Pāṭali Village

mn38:14.1.pli: “Imañce tumhe, bhikkhave, diṭṭhiṁ evaṁ parisuddhaṁ evaṁ pariyodātaṁ allīyetha kelāyetha dhanāyetha mamāyetha, api nu me tumhe, bhikkhave, kullūpamaṁ dhammaṁ desitaṁ ājāneyyātha nittharaṇatthāya no gahaṇatthāyā”ti?
mn38:14.1.en: “Pure and bright as this view is, mendicants, if you cherish it, fancy it, treasure it, and treat it as your own, would you be understanding how the Dhamma is similar to a raft: for crossing over, not for holding on?”

mn38:14.3.pli: “Imañce tumhe, bhikkhave, diṭṭhiṁ evaṁ parisuddhaṁ evaṁ pariyodātaṁ na allīyetha na kelāyetha na dhanāyetha na mamāyetha, api nu me tumhe, bhikkhave, kullūpamaṁ dhammaṁ desitaṁ ājāneyyātha nittharaṇatthāya no gahaṇatthāyā”ti?
mn38:14.3.en: “Pure and bright as this view is, mendicants, if you don’t cherish it, fancy it, treasure it, and treat it as your own, would you be understanding how the Dhamma is similar to a raft: for crossing over, not for holding on?”
